Articles.Content:
Salutations!

Today, it was announced that I will be a contestant in the National Bible Contest!

Only the top 25% or so make it.

Think it\'s easy, remembering 26 chapters of the Bible? Have fun!

http://www.mechon-mamre.org/p/pt/pt0201.htm

I just wanted to say this.

Congrats

I guessâ€¦â€¦â€¦...YOU SHOULD TOTALY CHEAT

Congrats

I guessâ€¦â€¦â€¦...YOU SHOULD TOTALY CHEAT

Lolnope.

Thanks, anyway.
Good going ... I am an athest so I don\'t like the bible, but good going memorising some book.
How do you actually manage to learn and remember all of it? ,_,

How do you actually manage to learn and remember all of it? ,_,

Have your whole tyranid army learn parts of it and use the hive mind so you know all of it.

Uhh... I\'ll go with what mario luigi said...

How do you actually manage to learn and remember all of it? ,_,

How do you learn your times tables or spelling words?

How do you actually manage to learn and remember all of it? ,_,

By having no life to speak of.

By having no life to speak of.

Correction, by having no life other than school, sleep, food, and the all important KSP

By having no life to speak of.

TIS A LIE!

All you need is to be able to speak Hebrew.

Then, you listen to the English audio track while reading the Hebrew.

INSTANT MEMORY!

Seriously, sometimes I brain so much my study hurts.
Achi, you need to be like those Haredi guys who only do that every day for eight hours a day. I guarantee you\'ll lose to one of them.

TIS A LIE!

All you need is to be able to speak Hebrew.

Then, you listen to the English audio track while reading the Hebrew.

INSTANT MEMORY!

Seriously, sometimes I brain so much my study hurts.

I must try this sometime...

Like when I play ksp too long forget about my German test and have to learn it the evening before.

Achi, you need to be like those Haredi guys who only do that every day for eight hours a day. I guarantee you\'ll lose to one of them.

I already did once. ;D
Exactly. You Conservative or Modern Orthodox?

Exactly. You Conservative or Modern Orthodox?

Conservative.

Sorry, but I\'m actually quite Secondary.

I keep no form of Kashrut, nor wear a kippa or tzizis, except on special, ceremonious occasions, like going to synagogue or to a Jewish choir event. However, I am having a large, ceremonious Ashkenazi Bar Mitzvah, which will be religious to a large extent. Imagine how silly this must sound to Gentiles!

Define Secondary.

I\'m Conservative as well, but I seem to be a tad on the observant side compared to you.

Define Secondary.

I\'m Conservative as well, but I seem to be a tad on the observant side compared to you.

Secondary as in doesn\'t Shomer Shabbes or do Grizin (Burial of holy texts) or destroy all the leaven, we just observe Hanukkah and try not to eat bread. We also tend to have a nice meal with kugel and stuff on Fridays.
It\'s Genizah, but I get what you mean.

It\'s Genizah, but I get what you mean.

Woops, lol.

Good luck, and despite my multi-linguistic capabilities (read: English, Spanish, French, partial Turkish (took classes, left before completion)), I cannot begin to understand Hebrew. You have it easier and harder, I suppose, as I am a christian and have partaken in quizzing events over our bible (which has 66 books for us protestants). However, we only quiz on a few books at a time. Good luck

Good luck, and despite my multi-linguistic capabilities (read: English, Spanish, French, partial Turkish (took classes, left before completion)), I cannot begin to understand Hebrew. You have it easier and harder, I suppose, as I am a christian and have partaken in quizzing events over our bible (which has 66 books for us protestants). However, we only quiz on a few books at a time. Good luck

Thanks!

This is only one book, too, but I have been taught about 10 of the books of the old Testament.

You speak Turkish?

Thanks!

This is only one book, too, but I have been taught about 10 of the books of the old Testament.

You speak Turkish?

I went to a charter school for 4th grade and took Turkish classes. I was only there for a year, as I utterly hated the facility. After leaving I never really finished up the study of that language. I can speak basically, however. Tesekkur Ederim (thank you, to the extent my keyboard allows).

Good luck, and despite my multi-linguistic capabilities (read: English, Spanish, French, partial Turkish (took classes, left before completion)), I cannot begin to understand Hebrew. You have it easier and harder, I suppose, as I am a christian and have partaken in quizzing events over our bible (which has 66 books for us protestants). However, we only quiz on a few books at a time. Good luck

Well for us 1 billion other catholics in the world we have to read... more then 66!

68 exactly
